resources.string: "Eat not to dullness; drink not to elevation."
Speak not but what may benefit others or yourself; avoid trifling conversation.
Let all your things have their places; let each part of your business have its time.
Resolve to perform what you ought; perform without fail what you resolve.
Make no expense but to do good to others or yourself; i.e., waste nothing.
Lose no time; be always employed in something useful; cut off all unnecessary actions.
Use no hurtful deceit; think innocently and justly, and, if you speak, speak accordingly.
Wrong none by doing injuries, or omitting the benefits that are your duty.
Avoid extremes; forbear resenting injuries so much as you think they deserve.
Tolerate no uncleanliness in body, cloths, or habitation.
Be not disturbed at trifles, or at accidents common or unavoidable.
Rarely use venery but for health or offspring, never to dullness, weakness, or the injury of your own or another\'s peace or reputation.
The virtue you choose will be the focus of your energy this week. Select a virtue and press \'Start\'.
Consider your judgements today for each of the 13 Virtues. Record them now, improve them tomorrow.
\"In the first week, my great guard was to avoid every the least offense against Temperance, leaving the other virtues to their ordinary chance, only marking every evening the faults of the day.\"

This app is designed to be a companion to Benjamin Franklin's system of self improvement. Ben created sets of spreadsheet like pages that he used to log his faults. He broke everything down into 13 distinct virtues which he believed were the foundation of a wholesome and productive lifestyle. Each night he recorded a new entry in these pre-formatted pages. He would mark a black dot next to any of the virtues where he felt he had fallen short of his personal expectations. 

This app is designed to be very simple, and passive. It's there to let you quickly launch the app, and rate yourself on your active virtue at any time. You should also make a nightly journal entry. By default, the app will remind you to do this at 10PM. This simply logs your rating for each of the 13 virtues.

Once you have recorded at least one journal entry you can access the progress screen, which provides a visual representation of your entries. The longer and more consistently you monitor your virtues, the more useful the app becomes.
Shortcut to android\'s sync settings menu
